Package ohos.data.file

Class FileAbility

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.app.AbilityContext
      • ohos.aafwk.ability.Ability
        • ohos.data.file.FileAbility
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILifecycle, Context

    public class FileAbility
extends Ability
    FileAbility is a special implementions of IDataAbility that facilitates secure sharing of a files associated with an app by creating a dataability://Uri for a file instead of file:/// Uri. You can include a FileAbility in your app by specifying it entirely in Json. To specify the FileAbility component itself, add a /Resources/rawfile/fileability.json in you app. You should adjust path conversion rules for example, you can only share the files in the fileability.json path.
    Since:
    6
    See Also:
    IDataAbility, Context, Uri

      • onStart

        public void onStart​(Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when an ability is started for initialization (it can be called only once in the entire lifecycle of an ability).

        Most initialization operations should be performed by calling this method. For example, you can use the current method to call Ability.setMainRoute(java.lang.String) and Ability.addActionRoute(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) to set the main router and action router for a Page ability.

        Overrides:
        onStart in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates information carried when this ability is started. Note: For a Service ability, null is passed.

      • query

        public ResultSet query​(Uri uri,
                       String[] columns,
                       DataAbilityPredicates predicates)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Queries one or more data records in the database. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.
        Overrides:
        query in class Ability
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the database table storing the data to query.
        columns - Indicates the columns to be queried, in array, for example, {"name","age"}. You should define the processing logic when this parameter is null.
        predicates - Indicates filter criteria. If this parameter is null, all data records will be queried by default.
        Returns:
        Returns the queried data.

      • getType

        public String getType​(Uri uri)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Obtains the MIME type matching the data specified by the URI of the Data ability. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.

        Data abilities supports general data types, including text, HTML, and JPEG.

        Overrides:
        getType in class Ability
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the URI of the data.
        Returns:
        Returns the MIME type that matches the data specified by uri.

      • getFileTypes

        public String[] getFileTypes​(Uri uri,
                             String mimeTypeFilter)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Obtains the MIME type of files. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.
        Overrides:
        getFileTypes in class Ability
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the files to obtain.
        mimeTypeFilter - Indicates the MIME type of the files to obtain. This parameter cannot be set to null.

        1. "*/*": Obtains all types supported by a Data ability.

        2. "image/*": Obtains files whose main type is image of any subtype.

        3. "*/jpg": Obtains files whose subtype is JPG of any main type.

        Returns:
        Returns the MIME type of the matched files; returns null if there is no type that matches the Data ability.

      • openRawFile

        public RawFileDescriptor openRawFile​(Uri uri,
                                     String mode)
                              throws FileNotFoundException
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Opens a raw file. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.
        Overrides:
        openRawFile in class Ability
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the raw file to open.
        mode - Indicates the open mode, which can be "r" for read-only access, "w" for write-only access (erasing whatever data is currently in the file), "wt" for write access that truncates any existing file, "wa" for write-only access to append to any existing data, "rw" for read and write access on any existing data, or "rwt" for read and write access that truncates any existing file.
        Returns:
        Returns the RawFileDescriptor object containing file descriptor.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - Throws this exception if the raw file does not exist.

      • openFile

        public FileDescriptor openFile​(Uri uri,
                               String mode)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Opens a file. This method should be implemented by a Data ability.
        Overrides:
        openFile in class Ability
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the path of the file to open.
        mode - Indicates the open mode, which can be "r" for read-only access, "w" for write-only access (erasing whatever data is currently in the file), "wt" for write access that truncates any existing file, "wa" for write-only access to append to any existing data, "rw" for read and write access on any existing data, or "rwt" for read and write access that truncates any existing file.
        Returns:
        Returns the FileDescriptor object of the file descriptor.
